intro: Ceratiosicyos laevis, commonly known as the smooth horned sicyos, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that are often followed by orange to red fruits. It is adapted to grow in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
